website_summaries.verdict: Made with durable, lightweight ripstock fabric, this RV cover is a good choice for dryer climates.
pros: Elastic-hem corners grip the tires and keep the cover in place
Adjustable front and rear tension panels and elasticized hem corners for a custom fit
Zippered panels allow access to the RV doors and storage compartment
cons: Ripstop fabric is not waterproof, so be sure to check after hard rains

customer_reviews.title: lasted 4 month in Arizona - than ripped down the ...
customer_reviews.text: lasted 4 month in Arizona - than ripped down the middle and split in two parts and fell to the ground. Called 800 number for warranty claim - said number no longer in service.
customer_reviews.author: GME.

customer_reviews.title: Shredded
customer_reviews.text: I used this cover to protect our camper and it shredded in less than two years (18 months). Our camper does sit in the direct sunlight. I noted this summer that some of the material started separating after a year. This weekend, it simply ripped in half end-to-end. While the material is light and easy to handle, I can't see the value if it only lasts one year. Bottom line, the rip-stop material doesn't stop rips.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wainner

customer_reviews.title: Only good as an inside cover to keep dust out and ...
customer_reviews.text: Only good as an inside cover to keep dust out and off the camper. Won't withstand wind. Ripped in several places sitting outside in the wind, the shortime the permanent cover was being built.
customer_reviews.author: Joetta M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I used the cover for one winter and summer. The upper edges of my camper wore holes in the cover. I repaired the holes. However, after one season, the fabric is so thin that it ripped while putting it on this winter. One week after I put it on, we had 30 mph winds and the thing ripped from end to end. The cover is of poor quality and was so loose on my 24 ft trailer it is no wonder it ripped in the wind. Do not waste your money on this cover!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ray

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely satisfied. I purchased it the next size up
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely satisfied. I purchased it the next size up; just to be certain it would fit.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good product, easy to install on 28' TT
customer_reviews.text: For a universal cover, it fits good. I am using it on a 28.5' Forest River Vibe TT and I think that's about all I could fit into it since the propane on the front is behind the fiberglass nose piece which adds some to the length. The straps all fit great and tighten up well and all in all the wife and I installed it in about 20 minutes. One tip I saw online is to use pool noodles cut and put over the extruding gutter system so it wont puncture the cover. Only concern I have is durability/longevity but I will update when this thing rips or gives up the ghost.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J

customer_reviews.title: Seller Support/Backing
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace our cover as this one eventually tore (top) in windy weather which was disappointing after approximately 18 months of use. However they sent us a brand new one and upheld the warranty of the first one. They were professional and had it shipped immediately following our submission of a claim. No hassle no debates, simply honored the warranty quickly. Cover is a good one as all these type covers tear in the wind. What makes this special is how the warranty was backed and processed. Thanks very much!
customer_reviews.author: DRC

customer_reviews.title: I dont recommend for outdoor
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 5 months. The sun made the material ripped. I dont recommend for outdoor cover
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Fit and strength.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 26.5’ TT. Went to install today and it didn’t fit. No fault of the company by any means. Make sure you measure and take into account your trailer height as well. Our trailer is 11’4” tall and this fits up to 8’6”. Also account for any AC units and a mounted ladder. Fabric is amazing and I really like the rip stop material. We gave this to our friends who have let us store our trailer on their property. We are using theirs for the season and will reorder a new longer one in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Grivetti

customer_reviews.title: We're getting some awesome protection
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd year for this cover. Just put it on for year 2. I purchased on for a 27' trailer, which should have been for a 22'. This provided extra room to cover the batteries, propane tanks & tow hitch. 1st year, we experienced exceptional protection for our Travel trailer. It breathed very well, kept our trailer very clean & protected. Due to the too larger size, we had to do some adjustments due to the amount of rain we got.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Measure your trailer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 27BHS travel trailer and ordered the 27 foot cover and it is big for the trailer. If you want a snugger fit, follow the instructions on measuring your trailer and order the size that fits snugger. I live in snow country and this is a replacement for and ADCO cover that lasted 5 winters so we'll see how it holds up. I'll try and remember to update the review in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rips easy and promotes mold.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for less than one year and my trailer is worse off as a result. The cover let water in the RV which ended up casing mold. The trailer is no longer usable. In addition the wind has now ripped the entire cover from end to end.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bielefeld

customer_reviews.title: surprised on quality, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 22-24ft model which ended up fitting my 2020 Genesis Vortex 1914v perfectly. straps on front and rear offer good adjustment options. straps on bottom could have been a bit longer but it did fit my wide toyhauler. material is very lightweight but seems to be high quality. no defects found in the one i bought. nice storage bag included along with easy install instructions. took me and my wife about 15 minutes to put on first time. so far i’m pleased with results.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chesser

customer_reviews.title: The front of the cover has a yellow tag to make it easy to identify when rolling it out
customer_reviews.text: I installed the cover yesterday myself and had little trouble doing so. The front of the cover has a yellow tag to make it easy to identify when rolling it out. The cover is lightweight and was packed into a duffel bag that I easily carried up the ladder. The "rock pouch" to throw the straps under the trailer is a great idea. It fit my 28' trailer well. We'll see how it survives the Michigan snow.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Feller

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: With one winter season on this cover it is holding up ok. It has a few small tears we will repair before next winter. I keep it on the trailer if the trailer is going more than a few weeks between uses. With the Colorado sun and weather I'd be suprised if this lasts more that a couple years. When you see what the weather does to covers here you understand why you need to protect your rvs finish. I do think this material is holding up better than others I see being ripped to shreds on rv's at the storage lot. To withstand Colorado weather and sun maybe I need something made from Kevlar!
customer_reviews.author: Elisha E

customer_reviews.title: The product is a rotten deal at $345!
customer_reviews.text: I live in western NC and travel about 2 months per year. My point is that I live in a relatively cool climate, not much intense sun like Florida or Texas and we keep this cover on most of the time. I got two and a half years out of it before it literally disintegrated and fell off the camper in a moderate wind. Sun damage caused the fabric to fall apart as if it it was made of rotted cotton. Should be priced at $145 in stead of $345! Would not buy again or recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cover
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why there are so many bad reviews. I just took my cover off and it's still like brand new. Protected my travel trailer very well from winter elements. The material is very similar to a fly on a tent. My only complaint would be that the cover is longer than expected. I have a 33' trailer and the 30-33' was still 3' too long. I tied the front under the batteries and it faired the elements fine. Good luck with yours. If it fit like a glove or even close, it would have 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Got 2 seasons out of it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in 2018 and had It on our camper for 2 winters. This spring (2020) we took it off and had big holes in the top. We didnt expect it to last much longer than 2 season so I guess we got what we expected out of it. We also didnt have any buffers such as cardboard or foam over the roof equipment. Maybe if we did it would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: arenner

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts a year.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 12 months with a few patch jobs along the way. The sun makes it disintegrate and tear easy. once the UV changes the fabric the slightest pressure shreds it. Zippers failed on first use. Definitely overpriced at $350. I’ve tried several others by Adco and this has been the best...queen of the pigs.
customer_reviews.author: BC - Jax

customer_reviews.title: Fingers Crossed !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to give a performance review at this time, as the cover has yet to be installed. Normally I do the install about mid-October. It remains in the carrying case provided and stored in my residence. I am intensely hopeful that the cover will prove as durable as advertised, having been horribly dismayed and far less than even marginally served by a previous cover from another manufacturer. I would welcome another opportunity to comment in review after our winter's season, perhaps early to mid-May of 2016. Thank You, Mr. Mitchell
customer_reviews.author: Grant Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed cover but order the exact size. Amazon will markup your next order when you return.
customer_reviews.text: Warning...Do not purchase any larger than the length of your trailer. Don't pay attention to the reviews that suggest you order larger. My 18' trailer with a 20' cover has about 3' of material left over in the front. I originally paid $199.00 plus tax for this cover. When I created a return for the cover and went back to purchase the correct size the price jumped to $250! Interestingly enough, when I accidentally used the incorrect payment method I cancelled that order and went back to reorder using the correct payment method. Guess what? The price jumped up to $254!!! Unreal. Oh, the cover will never roll up to fit into the original bag provided. It's impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Z

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a really nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a really nice cover. Very durable fabric. I don’t think there will be a problem making it through a Michigan winter. 27’-30’ covered my 28’ trailer and the tounge. Easy to put on, did it myself in about 30mins. Would have probably ordered the size below this one if I were to do it again. But still pleased overall. Update: cover is no where near water proof like I anticipated. Rain goes right through cover.
customer_reviews.author: ryan stein

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2017. I started ripping mildly after the first year and after this winter is was complete junk.....ripped down the middle and fell off the side. It lasted three seasons in Michigan. If you're willing to pay over $100 season for this thing then go for it. It will last you no longer than 2 or three years
customer_reviews.author: craylord

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the PermaPro cover.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the PermaPro cover last October. The cover is light and easy to install. You need to install the cover when there is no wind since the light material gets blown around easily. The tie down system kept the cover secure on the trailer but allowed good ventilation between the cover and the trailer. There were no tears in the fabric after the first winter even though we had quite a bit of snow and several periods of strong winds.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Heckley

customer_reviews.title: Does not stand up to winds
customer_reviews.text: Lasted approximately one year, then shredded in the spring winds of New Mexico. Started tearing within the first six months (fall weather, low winds), despite padding all sharp edges. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Choirmom

customer_reviews.title: Good cover, better service
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! The cover fit my Thor Wanderer Wagon (TB 287). No issues yet. We will see how the cover does over the winter. Update:. The Wisconsin winter claimed the cover. It destroyed the cover in a win storm. The first time it was salavageable however a spring storm after KO'ed the cover. I did contact the manufacturer and did receive a replacement free if charge though and the new cover lasted through the more mild winter. We'll see how next year goes! I've left the review at 5 stars as a result of the Customer service received.
customer_reviews.author: MickXDTD10

customer_reviews.title: second purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the second PermaPRO Deluxe that I've purchased. The first one lasted six years in PA winters....I think that is a fair life time. All zippers and stitching held up. The location of the zipper access points are perfect. Old cover failed in "corner " stress points. Obviously, I'd purchase again.

customer_reviews.title: Installation was pretty easy and it seems to be very well made ...
customer_reviews.text: We have only had it on our trailer for a couple of months so we won't know until spring how well it has held up against our Michigan winter. Installation was pretty easy and it seems to be very well made and good quality. We also notice that there were several other trailers in our storage place that were also using this brand and they appeared to be holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: It’s good for a year. Bad warranty and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 18 months on the original one and when they warranted the cover for UV deterioration and tearing, I was told that they will only warranty the original and not the replacement. Perfect!! Won’t be buying this one again, customer service is mediocre. Today the replacement tore off. Source of year was the UV deterioration.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch K.

customer_reviews.title: great cover
customer_reviews.text: This cover is really nice. It seems thin but has held up to a Vermont winter (including a windstorm and an ice storm) without tearing or being blown off. Easy enough to put on with two people. The door access panels are a nice bonus. We forgot to take the battery out of the smoke detector and being able to get back in there was really helpful
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: Cover for 22' to 24' camptrailer cover
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality. I was able to cover my camp trailer by myself. It went well except I didn't quite get the zipper lined up with my door. We've had a fairly mild winter so far. The cover has held up well with some pretty strong winds. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: LilyJO

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cover, nice fabric, nice design. Good fit. I would recommend that you take a close look for the "front end" tag before you put the cover on. We put the whole thing on and at back of the RV we noticed the "front" tag - AHHH had to take it off and redo. Easy enough to do, but at the end of a long day it was frustrating. I would recommend this cover.
customer_reviews.author: Donna W.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you verify size.  Measure your trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, easy to install. Only complaint is it is for 27-30 ft trailer. It's way too long for my 28 ft. Make sure you inquire with mfg for sizing. I could easily cover back bumper and spare tire, front propane tanks and maybe even tongue jack, but then it flags in wind due to how its strapped on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fading and decomposing in less than one year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased last July. This cover is fading, decomposing and now tearing. It is under warranty so I tried calling only to get a voice recording telling me to go online to submit warranty claim. I filled out form and attached pics. I hit send and the site tells me I was blocked from submitting and to call customer support? UHM..... Don't buy this until I update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great company
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great company. We had a problem with our zipper after several months of having it. I followed the directions for the Warranty, and no problem. Received a response very quickly saying a whole new replacement was on it's way. Got it in about a week later! Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Ricciardi

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Been on my camper for 4 months now ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Been on my camper for 4 months now in South Dakota winter, no rips or holes unlike my last one from Adco which only lasted 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Boiler Plate

customer_reviews.title: FITS 2018 APEX NANO 191RBS perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This fit my 2018 Apex Nano 191RBS perfectly. I did go one size large that the smallest size listed for my trailer. Installation instructions didn't seem to match how the cover was rolled up, in the package, but a friend helped me get on correctly. You definitely need at least 2 and preferably 3 people to do this.
customer_reviews.author: 3 FINGER GUITAR GUY

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime warranty
customer_reviews.text: A very good option to protect your travel trailer from the elements. Designed well and a good fit. A little effort is required to install and remove. But that effort is worth it to protect an expensive recreational home.
customer_reviews.author: RKS

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 24' Trailer Securely
customer_reviews.text: Cover is fairly lightweight, making it easier to install. However, it is still difficult to unroll on top of the trailer. Zippered carry case is a nice idea... but I doubt that it will ever fold back into that case. Straps secure the cover and zippered sides enable easy access with the cover on. Time will tell how well it holds up to wind and weather. Rockwood Mini Lite 2512
customer_reviews.author: Reed Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Durability Issue but Warranty Honored.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only 3 winters due to sun damage on the top surface. We were hoping for more longevity. However, I sent Classic Accessories my proof of purchase, filled out warranty claim form, and a few photos of the problem, and the warranty was honored with a replacement cover. I was pretty impressed with that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Might work if you live in the desert southwest.
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and made well but the one I received is not water resistant at all. The day after installation it rained and my travel trailer is completely soaked under the cover. What is this cover supposed to protect your RV from? Certainly not rain or snow.
customer_reviews.author: B Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Seemed large
customer_reviews.text: Measured from nose of trailer to rear of spare tire. that was 35' so I was worried it might be too small it fits that plus the propane tanks and trailer jack. I can read the logos on my trailer through the cover but it looks durable and has good access with the zippered panels.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Street

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money unless you can afford $400.00/year for replacement cover. I purchased this cover July 2018 and by September 2019 the top had completely disintegrated. I live in Arkansas and we did not have any snow or ice this past winter and during the summer my land is in the shade half the day. Very disappointed.....I figured I might have to replace every 5 years or so but simply not the case.....and of course like most I did not complete the waranty.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Cover is lightweight but appears to be well made. I liken it to a well made backpacking tent. Nylon woven so not a heavy fabric. I can see my RV LOGO through the fabric. That said, I believe it will offer protection from the elements. I live in south Texas, so protection from sun is my primary concern. I’ve only just installed it, so I can’t speak to it durability.
customer_reviews.author: BobG

customer_reviews.title: The Best Cover and they stand behind their product!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not prone to write reviews, but I've had this cover for 2+ years, this year winds were relentless and the cover took a beating. I was concerned it was riped, so I put in a warranty claim. I was pleasently surprised by the easy way this vendor just sent me another cover. I've never had such a great experience with warranties. Normally they always try to say it's not covered. On top, this is an extremely good cover. Buy without worries. This company is my new Hero!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cover at first, did not last past 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: Really hope this would be a great product that would provide good coverage and would last. The cover fits great, really liked all the straps and the way you can cinch it up all around the trailer. Unfortunately, after 18 months of use where I live in coastal Southern California with a very good climate, the top of the cover has totally disintegrated and the fabric is just falling apart. For the price, I would have hoped I would get more than a year out of this cover. I have filed for a warranty claim and hopefully, the manufacturer will replace this cover.
customer_reviews.author: William J.

customer_reviews.title: Let's water through
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with this cover until the first rain. It does not keep water off the camper and that was the number one reason I purchased a cover. Water collects in the bottom of the cover under the camper and you have to go around releasing it. Very disappointed in this cover. Also the cover runs large, was way too big for size I bought. That's not as much a problem as the fact it isn't even rain resistant.
customer_reviews.author: JPNik

customer_reviews.title: It fits great
customer_reviews.text: This is a 2 person install - both need to have a sense of humor - I suggest unrolling it on the ground first to make sure the orientation is correct, then roll it back up and install it - trust me don't do it on a windy day (can we say parachute).
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome RV Cover
customer_reviews.text: We store our RV in an outdoor lot when we are not using it. Researched a lot before choosing this one and we are extremely happy with this cover. It has really held up well against the elements. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: They honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is two years old with a three year warranty, at first, it was 5 stars. But with the California sun, I can barely touch it without it tearing. I will try to see if the warranty is any good. - shortly after I posted this comment, I submitted a request for a new cover - no problem, It came just a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: Jmteam

customer_reviews.title: Held up to high winds great
customer_reviews.text: Actually made it through an entire PA winter which was exceptionally bad this year. Also had lots of >25MPH winds which tore my other cover to shreds. However, this cover held up great. Now, to try and fold it up this spring :-)
customer_reviews.author: JediKnight

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: so far so good , the cover fit well and is fairly easy to install. i like it better than other covers ive had in the past i believe it will last longer than the others
customer_reviews.author: nickelback

customer_reviews.title: It fits like a glove and seems to be very durable
customer_reviews.text: Just got the cover and put it on. It fits like a glove and seems to be very durable. Straps hold the cover in place and looks nice too. Shipping was a little slow but it was during Thanksgiving so I expected it. I would buy again and when this one wears out I will purchase another one just hope it lasts for a while.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up in wind
customer_reviews.text: I live in Boise. This was great for about 10 months, then got a little rip in the front, then got shredded shortly thereafter. I padded my gutter spouts to make sure nothing was sharp but once that little rip started...
customer_reviews.author: DCRED

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Read several reviews before purchasing. Most said it was larger than expected, and we have 29' travel trailer, so ordered 27' to 30' cover. Was too small and had to return it for next larger size. Overall, like the fit and quality. Awaiting new cover now.
customer_reviews.author: NebrRN

customer_reviews.title: Really?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product on 3/26/17. Today, the cover is separating/tearing along the flat panels of the cover - no sharp edges, etc. Definitely be contacting Amazon/Manufacturer regarding warranty replacement! Update: Contacted Classic Accessories regarding the issue.They stood behind their product and promptly sent a replacement. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: John Skokauckas

customer_reviews.title: Avoid sharp corners or antenna metal. Cover objects, even short rubber antennas with protectors.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight. Zippers are convenient and in good locations. Fabric does not hold up to Florida sun. The cover is 4 to 5 months old and tears easily. I thin the top material needs to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Edel

customer_reviews.title: High quality cover
customer_reviews.text: Fits my camper perfectly ... actually had a few inches to spare (over the advertised size). Much lighter than my old cover which shredded after about 8 years. This has a lifetime guarantee based on its anti-rip fabric (so I'm hoping that it will last longer than my last one since it shouldn't shred). Well constructed and very nice looking as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Eshenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This product does not repel water in anyway.The rain soaks right thru.In the summertime it turns into an RV cooking bag!You know,like the ones used when cooking a turkey in the oven.Destroyed my led lighting strip because of the heat.This product is total garbage I do not recommend.If you want your RV to stay in good condition store it indoors.
customer_reviews.author: angel solano

customer_reviews.title: Put this on my Jayco X213 and was happy with the way it stayed on
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my Jayco X213 and was happy with the way it stayed on. Keeps all the crud and bird poop off over the winter. Now if I could only find the nice storage bag it came in. I have purchased this and used it for one storage season so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression is great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this cover fits. Easy to put on. I got the 27-30’ size and my trailer is a 2706WS Rockwood. Body is 27.5’ long and 32’10” from tip to tip. It covers everything except the electric tongue. It fits better than expected in all dimensions. Durability is still up in the air but I do like the material better than the usual ones I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: James Carr

customer_reviews.title: Good fit. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Seam came ripped. Replacement sent quickly. Going on second year of use no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Richard5709

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 28 foot travel trailer nicely enough extra length to cover the propane tanks
customer_reviews.text: High quality cover. Fit my 28 foot travel trailer nicely enough extra length to cover the propane tanks, electric lift and entire hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Saladino

customer_reviews.title: 1994 Winneabgo Brave worked well
customer_reviews.text: My winnebago is 29ft and this fitted really well. Easy to put in on and take it off and endured the rainy weather here just fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Just uncovered my trailer after the first winter ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Just uncovered my trailer after the first winter storage for the cover. Survived a winter in Ontario Canada with absolutely no tears in the cover or marks on the trailer. We had about six or seven major snowfalls and ice storms during the winter. I can't speak to how it would stand up to UV rays, but as a cold climate cover, couldn't ask for better results. Lightweight and easy to install. At this point I would highly recommend this cover. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk

customer_reviews.title: Great Cover
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Midwest just north of Kansas City the cover was on for seven months through the winter and showed no signs of wear. It was exposed to winds of 60mph. It never ripped, just had to tighten up the straps a few times .
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Storage cover
customer_reviews.text: A well though out and built camper cover. It even comes with a storage bag and throw bag to run the straps underneath. Zipper placement for the entry for is for the door forward of the axle. Plenty of air vents to reduce condensation. Material is a bit lite. Will see how it lasts the NY winter.
customer_reviews.author: J Scott

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and a Great Fit.
customer_reviews.text: A friend and I just installed the cover. It was very easy for 2 people. The cover fits the travel trailer very well. Only time will shows its durability. As of right now, I am very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Paster

customer_reviews.title: Failure of RV Cover as purchased and warrantied.
customer_reviews.text: The RV Cover failed in the 2nd year of a 3 year warranty to perform as the product was advertised. RV Cover ripped down the middle of the Camper during storage and failed to protect the RV. I submitted a claim and have not heard from the manufacturer in the time they advertised on their Product Support Page. I have submitted an updated email to the manufacturer requesting a status of the claim. I will update this review when the product support issues have been resolved.
customer_reviews.author: kholmes

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: PUT IT ON FOR THE FIRST TIME AT THE BEGINNING OF DEC 2018, AND JUST TOOK IT OFF. IT FELL APART AS WE TOOK IT OFF.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Torn to shreds in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 31 foot travel trailer which we put in storage outside. After only 6 months the storage facility called and let us know the cover was torn to shreds. Stored in the Denver, CO area, no very heavy snows or high winds. Was surprised how badly damaged it was when we went to get it. Would not recommend except perhaps for inside storage as a dust cover.
customer_reviews.author: TopTierTester

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Ordered November 26, 2018. Given as a Christmas present. Was put on camper in January 2019 and camper was put in storage for a year. Advertised as lifetime warranty. Now cover is in shreds, straps are rotted, fell apart when pulled. There are tears in corners, fabric has come about. Manufacturer does not cover if not purchased from them. I bought from Amazon for $277.33. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. NO STARS
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: High quality fabric and easy to use straps and buckles
customer_reviews.author: roger a appley

customer_reviews.title: Nice material, lightweight but didnt last long.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and lightweight, good value. But only has lasted 1 year before it started ripping, I now have it tapped together with duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: Deer Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfect but it was not folded in a way that allowed for ease of installation. One I remove it, I will fold it in a way that makes covering much easier. It’s too early to rate the warmth or water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Choosy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The cover was in warranty and Classic Accessories sent me a new one. That is excellent customer service. Purchased June of 2018. I went to the camper last night and the entire right side was ripped. The corners had ripped about a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It totally covers the unit
customer_reviews.text: A bit hard for one person to put on the trailer, but success was realized. Really like the availability of various door covers for selection. Hopefully it will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Girl

customer_reviews.title: Too thin
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this! Parked my trailer only 2 months ago and looked what happened. So thin it can not stand up to wind. Torn to shreds.
customer_reviews.author: colorado2

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy, I expected this to be waterproof or even somewhat resistant. It’s not the water leaks right through the material. Also has some tears where it rubbed through at a couple corners. Well at least it keeps the dirt off. I will look to buy a different brand / type.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Great camper cover
customer_reviews.text: working great on our Timber Ridge camper. Stayed well attached during 2 different wind storms came quickly = as advertised. had room to spare on both ends & has nice clamps to hold down & great zippers so can get to different areas of camper as needed
customer_reviews.author: rustydawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit
customer_reviews.text: Very classy look and fits like a glove on my 2014 Lance trailer. My wife and I put it on and cinched it up. My neighbors have commented on its appearance and asked where I bought it. We used foam rubber taped to sharp corners to avoid tearing the fabric. I’m happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey C

customer_reviews.title: Warranty IS NOT Lifetime
customer_reviews.text: The description says Limited Lifetime Warranty but the cover shipped with a tag that says it has a 4 Year Limited Warranty. BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good RV Cover
customer_reviews.text: Well just installed the cover last weekend and I have to say it was easier than I thought it was going to be. It took two of us to put it on. The quality I would have to say is good and the straps to tie it down are very good. We will see how it holds up thru the winter so I might need to write another review at that time. But for now I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert rempel

customer_reviews.title: Classic Accessories Heavy Duty Cover
customer_reviews.text: Cover fits good, did not install like instructions said, cover was rolled incorrectly for installation like stated when removed from storage bag. Tie down straps work great for holding cover tight in wind. Has vents on both sides. Only downfall is they should have put zippers on both sides of cover so slides could be put out for access to interior.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Florida sun from ruining our camper
customer_reviews.text: Fit nice . Good material with a lifetime warranty. Zippers on side make it convenient to get inside or in the storage area.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Meeks

customer_reviews.title: then the process was easy. I don't think it's water proof but it ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a little difficult unfolding on top of the camper. Once it was positioned right, then the process was easy. I don't think it's water proof but it will protect from snow and UV rays. I'm still able to use camper acces door easily. Now we will see how it holds up throughout the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: At first  -  "Was Durable"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this RV cover as a gift. The initial placement was easy. Due to our high winds and items on top of the RV caused the RV cover to rips/tear. The additional patch covers that were enclosed did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a pretty good cover for the price
customer_reviews.text: Been a few months and some extreme heat and wind and it hasn't ripped yet. Seems like a pretty good cover for the price. It it lasts two years I'll consider it worth the money. .
customer_reviews.author: SandFleaDDH

customer_reviews.title: The warranty is great.
customer_reviews.text: This product literally began to rot in less than two years. Prior to that it worked great. Update: Classic Accessories warranty replaced the cover with minimal effort on my part.
customer_reviews.author: percy jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone. They said it works perfectly and was exactly what they wanted and needed.
customer_reviews.author: JessB4

customer_reviews.title: Wont but again
customer_reviews.text: So California area. Bought this in May of 2018. Fabric rotted with wholes on top. It does not hold up. Lance trailer, no sharp objects or edges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for our 24 ft toy hauler.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a reasonable price. Easy to put on. Easy to strap up.
customer_reviews.author: Good to go!

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my 30' trailer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30' travel trailer and this cover was a foot too short. Liked the thickness and feel of the material. Easy to use, and replace in storage bag. I returned the 27-30' and ordered the 30-33' cover, which is being delivered today. I'll write a review on that after I put it on the trailer this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Lance R

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on. is wearing well. Second Season in Northern Michigan and in a high wind area and No rips.
customer_reviews.author: mark w. smith

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: It went on easily and has survived the winter months with out mishaps.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Rogers

customer_reviews.title: not even 2 years, put it on my 21 ...
customer_reviews.text: not even 2 years, put it on my 21 feet trailer and took it off about 9 times, and its all ripped now especially on the edges, it looked solid when i put it on the first time, now its just trash.
customer_reviews.author: vlad girzhu

customer_reviews.title: Sizing way off
customer_reviews.text: So the size I bought was for 20-22 feet of trailer. My trailer is 21 feet. This thing is so damn enormous that it says, nothing will tighten and blows in the wind. Never will I trust this companies sizing
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S.

customer_reviews.title: Cover holds in storm.
customer_reviews.text: My cover has been great. We recently had a storm with 60 mph straight line winds. Trees down, damage everywhere. Our cover stayed put no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Mathews

customer_reviews.title: This product is fantastic. Very easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. Very easy to apply. So far is holding up against the windy winter. I confirmed with the company that this product is backed by a lifetime warrenty.
customer_reviews.author: wouldntyouliketoknow

customer_reviews.title: Great cover for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Classic Accessories cover I have purchased. The first cover lasted about 4 years be fore it started tearing in spots. This new cover seems more durable and I like the fitted elastic stitching on the bottom of cover. Fit perfectly and was easy to install!! Will have to see if it lasts as long as my first cover.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories OverDrive PermaPro Heavy Duty Cover for up to 20' Travel Trailers, Grey (Limited
product_meta.description:
Size:Fits up to 20' Trailers| Color:Grey



 PROTECTION IN ANY CLIMATE OR SEASON
Weather and Damage Protection
PermaPRO covers by Classic Accessories provide maximum protection from rain, snow, dirt and UV damage. Ripstop fabric is stronger and 57% lighter than most RV covers available. Rolling up and storing your RV cover has never been easier. Each cover comes in an expandable storage bag that unzips to reveal five additional inches of height in storage space. The bag can fit into storage spaces as small as 13” x 23” x 18”. Backed by a four year warranty. 

Prevent Rips and Tears
NEW lightweight PermaPRO ripstop fabric provides maximum strength protection

COMPACT!
Expandable zippered storage bag fits into small storage compartments

Fits to Your Vehicle 
Adjustable front and rear tension panels with elasticized hem corners give a custom fit 

Accessibility
Zippered panels with extra long zipper pulls reduce the need for a ladder

Ventilation
Air vent system reduces wind stress and interior moisture 

Easy Installation
Integrated strap attachment and weighted toss bag system




 FIND THE RIGHT COVER FOR YOUR RV 
Class A Cover

Class C Cover

5th WHEEL Cover

TRAVEL TRAILER Cover

 PROTECTION IN ANY CLIMATE OR SEASON
Weather and Damage Protection
PermaPRO covers by Classic Accessories provide maximum protection from rain, snow, dirt and UV damage. Ripstop fabric is stronger and 57% lighter than most RV covers available. Rolling up and storing your RV cover has never been easier. Each cover comes in an expandable storage bag that unzips to reveal five additional inches of height in storage space. The bag can fit into storage spaces as small as 13” x 23” x 18”. Backed by a four year warranty. 

Prevent Rips and Tears
NEW lightweight PermaPRO ripstop fabric provides maximum strength protection

COMPACT!
Expandable zippered storage bag fits into small storage compartments

Fits to Your Vehicle 
Adjustable front and rear tension panels with elasticized hem corners give a custom fit 

Accessibility

Ventilation

Easy Installation

feature_bullets: TRAVEL TRAILER COVER: Fits travel trailers 18' - 20' long, 118" high from ground to roof

RV ACCESSORIES: Adjustable front and rear tension panels and elasticized hem corners provide a custom fit, air vent system and quick drying PermaPRO fabric combine to reduce wind stress and vent inside moisture, long zipper pulls reduce the need for a ladder

RV STORAGE COVER: Extra strength, lightweight PermaPRO ripstop fabric repels water and protects against dirt and sun damage, integrated strap attachment and weighted toss bag system eliminates crawling under the RV to install tension straps, tension panels reduce cover stress when tightening the straps
RV COVER WITH ACCESS PANELS: Zippered panels allow access to the RV doors and storage compartments, panels allow access to all four sides
CAMPER COVER WITH WARRANTY: Zippered storage bag unzips and expands for easy packing, includes lifetime warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars539 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
